job_description:
Organization Overview

UNICEF USA (“UUSA” or “We”) relentlessly pursues a more equitable world for every child, upholding the rights of all children and empowering every child, everywhere. We also support the fundamental belief that children should have a voice and role in shaping their futures and the futures of their communities.

Over eight decades, the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) has built an unprecedented global support system for the world’s children, and has boldly taken on the biggest, seemingly impossible challenges facing children. UNICEF relentlessly works day in and day out to deliver the essentials that give every child an equitable chance in life: health care and immunizations, safe water and sanitation, nutrition, education, emergency relief and more. UNICEF USA advances the global mission of UNICEF by rallying the American public to support the world’s most vulnerable children.

We know that sustainable change is attainable, but it can’t be achieved alone. It takes a committed team – individuals, governments, corporations, volunteers and staff – who demonstrate a relentless commitment to working tirelessly, day in and day out in some of the toughest, hardest to reach places. Big problems need big solutions, and we harness our collective, global voice and energy to do better, in more places for children. We will never stop supporting UNICEF to develop smarter, more cost-effective solutions; scaling up proven, data-driven programs; and harnessing new technologies to create measurable change for children.

UUSA is organized under the laws of New York State as a not-for-profit corporation. As such, UUSA is a tax-exempt organization as defined under Section 501(c)3 of the Internal Revenue Code and is governed by an independent, non-salaried Board of Directors.

Position: Senior Director, Foundation Partnerships

Location: Nationwide / Remote

FLSA Status: Exempt

Salary: The estimated salary range for this position is $125,500 - $144,100. This midpoint for the salary grade is $163,200. Actual pay will vary based on various factors, including but not limited to relevant experience.

Position Description

The Senior Director is a senior leader on the Foundation Partnerships team, responsible for leading the development of thematic strategies for a portfolio focused on Education, Child and Social Protection, Advocacy, Data, Social Behavior Change, Innovation and Gender. The role will serve to cultivate partnership development, proactively growing and securing new partnerships with leading U.S. private foundations and institutions, and directly overseeing the workstream a The Senior Director reports to the Vice President.

Position Responsibilities

Strategy & Operations (40 percent)
• Lead the development of Education, Child and Social Protection, Advocacy, Data, Social Behavior Change, Innovation and Gender vertical-wide partnership strategy, including conducting or overseeing landscape mapping, research and analysis, and build stewardship strategies.
• Oversee the development of specific Education, Child and Social Protection, Advocacy, Data, Social Behavior Change, Innovation and Gender focused thematic outreach and engagement strategies.
• Manage and oversee four program thematic vertical staff. Mentor, and coach direct reports to manage increasingly complex funding relationships and grants, and foster professional development.
• Initiate innovative ideas to generate new revenue and add value to partnerships and develop compelling presentations and proposals. This includes potential challenges, competitions, innovative financing, and new ways of working together to achieve intended outcomes.
• Support the skills development and training of staff on partnership development.
• Forecast and develop budget projections for foundation partnerships.
• Monitor vertical revenue and provide updates on revenue projections; identify and address any anticipated issues in meeting budget expectations.
• Liaise with UNICEF USA finance and compliance personnel to resolve any legal, procedural or financial issues regarding grants, sub-grants and contracts.
• Maximize outcomes by partnering with internal UUSA teams (Finance, Individual and Institutional Philanthropy, Marketing & Communications, Philanthropy Insight, Philanthropy Advancement and the Impact Fund for Children) to leverage resources.
• Partner with Philanthropy Advancement and Philanthropy Insight to understand latest trends and research and support performance measurement.
• Work closely with UUSA senior leadership and UNICEF technical experts and program leads to identify needs, opportunities, and alignment with programmatic priorities.
• Contribute to thought-leadership objectives to grow the UNICEF brand within the foundation landscape.

Partnership Development (50 percent)
• Leads relationships with key donors investing in Education, Child and Social Protection, Advocacy, Data, Social Behavior Change, Innovation and Gender.
• Advises in development and implementation of new partnership engagement and strategies.
• Seeks and promotes new partnerships in alignment with the programmatic thematic pillar to support of the larger UNICEF agenda, working with UNICEF colleagues to identify partnership needs, objectives, and funding gaps.
• Identifies, stewards, and manages a portfolio of diverse prospects and partners to expand UNICEF’s reach and involvement with the goal of mobilizing resources. Supports the team to facilitate successful partnerships.
• Receives and screens inquiries from potential collaborators and facilitates communication with appropriate UNICEF USA and UNICEF colleagues.
• Expands UNICEF and UNICEF USA’s network of key interlocutors to build stronger relationships and thought leadership engagements to advance partnerships.
• Develops and maintains deep knowledge and familiarity with current and prospective partners and relevant stakeholders, contributing to a database of key contacts and to UNICEF USA’s base of knowledge on partnership and overall larger objectives.
• Cultivate, manage and grow relationships with foundation prospects and secure annual revenue of at least $2.5 Million.

Grants Management (10 percent)
• Provides oversight on overall grants management activities of the vertical workstream, focused on Education, Child and Social Protection, Advocacy, Data, Social Behavior Change, Innovation and Gender programming.
• Troubleshoot and provide guidance on grants management activities.
• Identify opportunities to communicate grants impact and outcomes across UNICEF USA and UNICEF.
• Negotiate partnership terms and contracts.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree with a minimum 10-12 years’ experience in a partnership management or strategic partnerships role; a mix of foundation and non-profit experience preferred.
• Advanced degree in international development, international relations, global/public health, or a related field welcome.
• Experience managing a team and supporting their growth.
• Significant relationship-building skills including with a network of institutional foundations, ability to generate revenue, and partnership management experience
• Preferred experience with Education, Child and Social Protection, Advocacy, Data, Social Behavior Change, Innovation and Gender focused development programming.
• Proven ability to generate revenue growth; ability to identify and pursue new opportunities
• Ability to build relationships with individuals with diverse personalities and styles and at different levels of seniority, from assistants to C-level leadership
• Ability to develop and execute a business or account plan including goals, metrics, strategy, and tactics
• Ability to navigate complex relationships, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and to prioritize multiple deadlines
• Excellent problem solving and negotiation skills; ability to effectively collect, analyze, organize distill and present information
• Excellent written and oral communication skills
• Self-motivated; ability to lead projects independently from concept to completion
• Some travel required, within the U.S. and internationally

Must possess current and valid US Work Authorization and be eligible to work for any US employer without sponsorship.

Due to the high volume of applications received, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

UNICEF USA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law. UUSA is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at peopleandculture@unicefusa.org.
